text: Bitter and sour peppercorn body with a raisin aftertaste and a bit of apple.

On tap at the brewery pours a murky garnet amber with some lacing, sticky, off white head. Nose is solid, tart cherry, pomegranate vinegar, raisin, candy, stale red wine. Flavor has some stale cherry soda, raisin, prune, lurking vanilla/wood, a little cherry vinaigrette, some raspberry leaf tea. Dry and tart, lightly tannic. For a house foudre beer, this is good. Approachable with nice structure.

Draft taproom. Amber. Somewhat sweet fruity aroma. Flavor is sweet dark fruit, lightly bitter, sweet caramels. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rich copper and ruby tinted body with a thinnish tan head and an amazing hazy glow that really stands out! Aroma of wild yeastie funk, earth, bread, sour brett, grain, alcohol and some light fruits like apples and pears. Medium-bodied; Assertive effervescence with some pungent yeast and brett characteristics that run a bit long and show some light spiciness, some dry grass and hay flavours and a bit of toffee. Aftertaste is rich, and showing the wild, funky side very strongly with the yeast and light spices as the only strong taste. Some light malt and sugars round out the palate, but this is all about the yeast strain and some subtleties. Overall, a nice beer to sample, but im not sure what any fuss is about on this one, its fairly mundane, albeit nice to sample. I wouldnt go out of my way to try this one though. I sampled this sixteen ounce pour on draught at Whole Foods in Pentagon City (Arlington), Virginia on 09-February-2017 at the end of my driveway.
Draft - pours reddish brown white head - nose/taste of cherry, oak, fruity caramel and grape - medium body
(Draught) Pours a cloudy amber-orange body with a small white head. Aroma of brown sugar, grain, caramel, strawberry, blueberry, and raisins. Flavor of caramel, orange, raisins, stone fruit, and oak.

A dark copper amber ale with a very thin off white head. In aroma, nice mix of tart apples and light Brett, light lactic notes, nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light woody character, light mineral notes, light cork, ground cherries, nice and smooth. On tap at Beer Authority NYC.
Tap at Rattle n Hum lovely nose of dried fruits and leaf litter. Tastes of bretty yeast, leaves, grassy, grains, plenty of the French oak, some sweet berry. Lively palate easy drinking and fun beer.

Tap. Pours quite hazy chestnut, smash beige head, some lacing. Aroma is light, bretty. Grass, Belgian spice, clove, oak tannins, white wine. Flavor is light sweet, very light bitter, grassy, hint of tartness. Medium body, soft mouthfeel

4oz pour at the Right Proper Brewing Production House. Poured a dark ruby red color with a small off-white head. Aroma was light tart notes, stone fruits, sweet. Grains, raisin notes. Touch of sour tart finish on it. Pretty tasty.

Tap at Right Proper in Shaw. Dark ruby amber with low tan foam. This one was outstanding in every way - some vinous red wine barrel character comes through in both nose and flavor. Rustic grain and heavy dark bread crust separate this from your regular dark sour into clearly Biere de Garde. Minerally water profile, medium-bodied, with almost no sugar remaining. Still, the acid is super low to almost zero, sugar absent, grain presence is the primary focus. Rich depth of malt flavors interplay within a highly drinkable body. It really was outstanding. Our group went for seconds on this one.

Hops Hill, Brooklyn tap: pours reddish with an off white head. Aroma is kind of like a sour red, yeasty, woody, and all that. Taste is a bit sour. Pretty big sweetness happening there too. Lingering sugary aftertaste. Interesting but not really my thing.

Tap. Hazy darker copper brown, thin light tan head. Slight sour dark fruits, some leafy notes, dark cereal malt in the aroma. Flavor is more akin to a light Flanders red, but dialed down. Medium body. Pleasant.
At the Brookland brewery. Light brown in hue, delicate bubbles. Raisins and plums. Best on the menu.

Draft. Medium off-white head that mostly dissipates atop hazy garnet body. Aroma is moderately sweet, oak, light spicy, funk, raisin. Taste is moderately sweet, raisin, some wood, light sour, orange. Medium body, low carbonation.
Some light citrus and a little peel. A hint of plum and some oak. Hazy brown pour with great head and lacing. Light tangy finish. Tap at brewery in Brookland.
4oz draft at Right Proper-Brookland. Cloudy amber with bare head. Sour yeast, vinegar, sour grains. Interesting, good.

4 oz pour on draft at Right Proper Brookland. Clear dark amber with off-white head. Aromas of slightly tart dark fruit, subtle vinegar. Tastes of slight tartness, plums, dark fruit, light tart acidic notes. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Draft at Paradiso Dupont. Hazy deep amber color. Aroma of dark fruit, tannins, caramel. Taste has port wine, butterscoth, more tannins, vanilla. Very nice.
